Jamal Abdul Rahim Aboalward (also spelled Jamal Aboalvard; Arabic: جمال عبد الرحيم أبو الورد) is a Syrian–Turkish mathematician, academic, and international trainer. He is known for his research in linear algebra and matrix theory, his educational roles, and his public engagement with science.
Early life
Aboalward was born in 1971 in Kafr Jales, Idlib, Syria.
Academic career
Aboalward has worked as a lecturer, scientific advisor, and deputy minister at the Syrian Ministry of Higher Education (responsible for external affairs and scientific research). His research focuses on linear algebra, eigenvalue localization, and Gershgorin’s theorem.
In 2004, he obtained the first officially registered intellectual property in mathematics in Syria. He has presented papers at international conferences, including the International Conference on Syrian Education (ICSE) held in Istanbul, Turkey, in February 2017.
Publications
* Matrices and Gershgorin’s Theorem (in Arabic), Al-Majd Advanced Scientific Journal (2024).
* Effect of Information Technology on Financial Performance of Companies (in Arabic), Al-Majd Advanced Scientific Journal (2024).
Recognition and roles
Aboalward has been mentioned in Syrian Ministry of Education curricula as a Syrian mathematician. He has also worked as an international trainer in creativity and innovation, delivering programs and lectures in various countries.
He has received numerous international scientific awards and certificates of appreciation in recognition of his academic and training contributions, including honors from Morocco, Japan, and Turkey.
Legacy
Aboalward is regarded by regional media as "the Khwarizmi of the era".
